title: Senior Producer – Star Wars
content:
At NaturalMotion, we make games that wow people. We innovate to create experiences that previously were impossible and that would not exist without us. We take pride in making titles that reach a large audience and in creating communities that last. For the past six years, NaturalMotion Studios have been named as one of the Best Places to Work in the UK games industry by gamesindustry.biz.
Job Purpose
We are looking for a Senior Producer to join us in creating Star Wars™: Hunters, a competitive arena combat game for the Nintendo Switch system and mobile devices. Star Wars: Hunters will bring players together to engage in thrilling, team-based, multiplayer battles featuring a diverse array of distinctive new Star Wars characters.
Our Producers own and run the production schedule and roadmaps of feature team(s), while helping build a productive and predictive  environment that encourages team ownership. You will also play a part in the continuous improvement of our production standard processes with your peers in production. We are looking for a motivated and experienced individual to help drive project management standard methodologies and processes: Focusing on HOW our games are made!
Under the direction of a Lead Producer, you will be directly responsible for driving teams to complete specific project goals for cross-disciplined groups. Plan time, resources and track progress against the goals set for the team. Working closely with leaders in other crafts to ensure the development team has the vital understanding of high-level business goals and the means with which to complete them.
Key Roles & Responsibilities

Day-to-day team management, helping your team to remain focused and actively working on their tasks
Triaging, assigning and prioritizing the team’s tasks and bugs while facilitating the team's ability to turn requirements into achievable plans
Capturing team production data such as capacity & velocity to feed your project plans
Project road mapping, backlog refinement, sprint planning & reviews, retrospectives, dependency management
Identifying, tracking and mitigating risks to the project
Working with external teams including outsource vendors, licensors and publisher teams
Agile development using methodologies such as Scrum/Kanban

Required Skills & Experience

Producer/Project Manager with experience working across the full games development lifecycle from concept to post-launch
Experience leading large teams, focusing on outstanding organisation, communication and team building skills
SCRUM/Agile/Waterfall development experience, with rapid and live development
Experience of using Jira, Confluence, Miro, Google/Office suite or other project management, reporting and tracking tools
A history of leading multidisciplinary teams, from Art to Engineering

What we offer you

Competitive salary and discretionary annual bonus scheme 
Create next-gen games that will be played and loved by millions of players around the world
Work in a family-oriented, collaborative team that invests in your development and growth on-the-job
A diverse team of friendly, fun and supportive co-workers
Flexible working hours & crunch-free working culture
Communal music and laid-back atmosphere
Summer/Christmas parties and Happy Hour in the studio each Friday
26 days holiday + bank holidays, 2 paid personal days 
6 months of fully paid maternity/adoption leave or 16 weeks of fully paid paternity leave (eligibility criteria apply)
Pension plan with a double matching employer contribution (capped at 8%)
Private medical insurance, dental insurance and healthcare cash plan
Life insurance, accident insurance and long-term disability insurance
Company Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) (eligibility criteria apply)
Fitness Reimbursement plan worth £600 per annum
Charitable Giving Platform to which the Company contributes a 2:1
Annual season ticket advance and cycle to work scheme

As part of our Diversity and Inclusion Strategy we would like to collect demographic information from job candidates to identify and implement strategies to understand and improve equal opportunity for all at Zynga. Completion of this information is entirely voluntary and any details you provide will not be considered in the hiring process. Zynga will anonymize demographic information for reporting and analytics to gain a better understanding of our hiring process. This  information will only be used internally within Zynga and stored securely on our systems.  

For Zynga’s full privacy notice, click here for US Job Applicant privacy notice and here for the Outside of the US Job Applicant Privacy Notice . You can email Privacy@zynga.com for more information regarding the collections and use of your data.
